Posts.Content: sarajaneevans wrote: .I got my diagnosis today,Invasive mammary carcinoma with lobular features.... I see the surgeon on Monday. Would like to get a second opinion...anyone here familiar with this diagnosis? I am not sure what to make of it.... When you can't do anything, You do what you can. Dx 4/29/2013, ILC, Left, 6cm+, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 1/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- (IHC) Surgery 5/15/2013 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Surgery 6/6/2013 Lumpectomy: Left Chemotherapy 6/24/2013 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 10/14/2013 Arimidex (anastrozole) Radiation Therapy 11/5/2013 Breast Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Not sure what to think..... sarajaneevans Shirlann

Posts.Content: sarajaneevans wrote: I know this sounds really strange-- I had my second lumpectomy on June 7th, start chemo this Tuesday-- for about a week now I hear what sounds like liquid slushing around in my breast-- it is very intermittent- I notice it mostly when I am descending the stairs in my home..but on occasion when walking on a flat surface-- I am wondering if I am nuts or what? Has anyone else experienced this??? When you can't do anything, You do what you can. Dx 4/29/2013, ILC, Left, 6cm+, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 1/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- (IHC) Surgery 5/15/2013 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Surgery 6/6/2013 Lumpectomy: Left Chemotherapy 6/24/2013 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 10/14/2013 Arimidex (anastrozole) Radiation Therapy 11/5/2013 Breast Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: sound of water or liquid slushing around in the breast sarajaneevans sarajaneevans
